alert.note: Alert for Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 23 at 3:54AM MDT until June 23 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR SOUTHWEST NEW MEXICO TODAY DUE TO WARM, DRY, AND BREEZY WEATHER... .Southwest flow aloft increases this afternoon in response to a weak storm system over the Four Corners region. Above normal temperatures and very dry air will combine with gusty southwest winds to create high fire danger. Sustained 20-ft winds of 20 to 25 mph will be possible with gusts up to 35 mph in the afternoon. Any fires that develop will have the potential for rapid fire growth. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL MEXICO... * AFFECTED AREA...Portions of southwest and south-central New Mexico, including fire weather zones 110, 111, 112, and 113. * TIMING...Noon to 9 PM Today. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 12 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Afternoon Highs 90 to 100 degrees. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
